did.unittitle: New York City Public Works Construction Photograph Collection
did.abstract: This is a small collection of photographs of several New York City public works projects constructed in the 1930's to 1950's.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Additional materials relating to the construction industry in New York City can be found in the Frank Pagliaro Construction Records Collection, PR 282.

Photographs of construction sites can be found in a number of other collections, including the Geographic File, PR 20, the Frank M. Ingalls Photograph Collection, PR 28, and the Robert M. Lester Photograph Collection, PR 215.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as: New York City Public Works Construction Photographs Collection, PR 302, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photographs of several public works projects constructed in New York City in the 1930's-1950's. Projects include sewage plants, Grand Central Parkway (gas station), 86th Street Pumping Station, Lincoln Hospital, Neponsit Beach Hospital, Harlem Welfare Center, Betsy Head Bath House, and Jamaica High School. The photographs belonged to Harold H. Klein, a Civil Engineer who worked on a number of public works projects in and around New York City in the early part of his career in the construction industry.
